title: Chinese Government provides equipment worth $6.9 million USD to Cuba's livestock recovery program (Linked to Project ID#64265)
description: On March 16, 2018, the Chinese Government provided a grant of $6.9 million USD worth of equipment to support Cuba's livestock recovery program. China's Ministry of Commerce sent a working group to inspect the completed project in May-June 2018.  This project was one of six Chinese-funded projects in Cuba, worth a combined total of $36 million USD, which were completed in 2018. The other five projects are captured by project IDs #54850, #54806, #54808, #54809, #69352, and #70160. The total $36 million USD in spending is captured by linked umbrella project ID#64265.
staff_comments: This project is also referred to as the Dairy Plant Equipment Procurement Project. The Chinese name is 奶厂设备采购项目.This project may have initially been committed on March 25, 2015, when the Chinese Government signed an exchange of notes with Cuban Government for the Slaughterhouse Plant Project (宰厂项目的), which was intended to develop the agro-pastoral product processing industry, as captured by project ID#54852 (see '中古两国政府签署关于实施屠宰厂项目的换文'). Although the two projects have different names, they have very similar purposes (related to further developing the livestock industry). However, AidData has, for the time being, decided against treating them as one and the same project because of the lack of additional information about the projects and the lack of direct evidence linking the two. This issue merits further investigation.It is unclear whether this donation was formally committed in 2018. This issue merits further investigation.
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title

# Description
On March 16, 2018, the Chinese Government provided a grant of $6.9 million USD worth of equipment to support Cuba's livestock recovery program. China's Ministry of Commerce sent a working group to inspect the completed project in May-June 2018.  This project was one of six Chinese-funded projects in Cuba, worth a combined total of $36 million USD, which were completed in 2018. The other five projects are captured by project IDs #54850, #54806, #54808, #54809, #69352, and #70160. The total $36 million USD in spending is captured by linked umbrella project ID#64265.
justification: Project focuses on livestock recovery and agricultural development without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Livestock recovery program, agricultural equipment provision, no mention of energy or environmental components

title: Chinese Government provides rice worth $7.7 million USD to Cuba (Emergency Rice Assistance Project) (Linked to Project ID#64265)
description: On March 16, 2018, the Chinese Government and the Government of Cuba signed an agreement in which the Chinese Government committed to donating rice worth $7.7 million USD to serve as emergency food aid to Cuba. Further implementation details are unknown.  This project was one of six Chinese-funded projects in Cuba, worth a combined total of $36 million USD, which were completed in 2018. The other five projects are captured by project IDs #54850, #54806, #54808, #54809, #69352, and #70160. The total $36 million USD in spending is captured by linked umbrella project ID#64265.
staff_comments: The Chinese name for this project is 紧急大米援助.'China delivers aid funds to Cuba worth 36 mln USD for development' and other sources explicitly state that the Chinese and Cuban governments signed on a document on this donation. When and whether the actual donation went through is unknown. This issue merits further investigation.
combined_text:

title: Chinese Government donates a set of hydraulic system maintenance equipment (Linked to Project ID#64265)
description: On March 16, 2018, the Chinese Government and the Government of Cuba signed a handover certificate for China's donation of a set of hydraulic system maintenance equipment to Cuba. The project would allow for the provision of construction equipment to help Cuba repair and maintain its hydraulic works. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  This project was one of six Chinese-funded projects in Cuba, worth a combined total of $36 million USD, which were completed in 2018. The other five projects are captured by project IDs #54850, #54806, #54808, #54809, #69352, and #70160. The total $36 million USD in spending is captured by linked umbrella project ID#64265.
staff_comments: It is unclear whether this donation was formally committed in 2018. This issue merits further investigation.

title: Chinese Government agrees to increase agricultural aid to Cuba
description: On January 25, 2018, the Chinese Government (represented by the Economic and Commercial Office of the Chinese Embassy in Cuba) and Cítricos Caribe S.A. (CCSA), a Cuban state-owned export-import fruit and vegetable company, signed an implementation contract on increasing agricultural aid to Cuba (Chinese agreement name: 《援古巴农业物资增收项目的对外实施合同》). Officials from the Economic and Commercial Office and Cuba's Ministry of Agriculture discussed procedures on bilateral aid projects after the signing. It is unclear whether any projects resulted from this agreement.
combined_text:

title: Chinese Consulate-General of Curacao Donates Materials for Irene Moreno Table Tennis Complex in Curacao
description: In 2018, the Chinese Consulate-General of Curacao donated materials to the 30 year-old complex that was in need of renovation, including higher quality vinyl flooring, LED lights system, match tables and training equipment. On June 14th, 2019, the re-opening ceremony of the Irene Moreno table tennis complex occurred in Curacao and included a table tennis tournament with Curacao, Aruba and Bonaire. 60 people attended this event including government officials and the president of the Curacao Table Tennis Federation.  The financial valuation of these items is unknown.
combined_text:
# Sector

On June 14th, 2019, the re-opening ceremony of the Irene Moreno table tennis complex occurred in Curacao and included a table tennis tournament with Curacao, Aruba and Bonaire. 60 people attended this event including government officials and the president of the Curacao Table Tennis Federation.  The financial valuation of these items is unknown.
justification: Project involves donation of materials for sports facility renovation, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of materials for table tennis complex renovation, social development focus

title: China donates 1500 books to the National Library of Curaçao
description: On September 14, 2018, China’s Overseas Chinese Affairs Office of Guangdong Province donated books about Chinese culture, language, history and literature to Curaçao's National Library. The Chinese Consulate-General of Willemstad also donated English-version books about Chinese politics, economy, culture, arts, science, and technology. In total, they donated about 1,500 books.
combined_text:
# Sector

The Chinese Consulate-General of Willemstad also donated English-version books about Chinese politics, economy, culture, arts, science, and technology. In total, they donated about 1,500 books.
justification: Project involves donation of educational materials without direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of 1500 books about Chinese culture, language, history, and literature to a national library

title: Chinese Government donates 1,000 tons of rice worth $1.02 million USD to North Korea in 2018 (Linked to Project ID#63132)
description: From May 7, 2018 to May 8, 2018, Chinese President Xi Jinping met with North Korean Kim Jong-Un in Dalian, China. It was widely reported at the time that the Chinese Government would promise a new aid package to North Korea during the meeting. Then, in July 2018, the Chinese Government donated 1,000 tons of rice worth $1.02 million to the Government of North Korea (captured via Project ID#63061). By October 2018, the Chinese Government had also donated 162,007 tons of urea fertilizer worth $55.03 million to the Government of North Korea (captured via Project ID#63132).
combined_text:
# Sector
DEVELOPMENTAL FOOD AID/FOOD SECURITY ASSISTANCE

# Title
Chinese Government donates 1,000 tons of rice worth $1.02 million USD to North Korea in 2018 (Linked to Project ID#63132)

# Description
From May 7, 2018 to May 8, 2018, Chinese President Xi Jinping met with North Korean Kim Jong-Un in Dalian, China. It was widely reported at the time that the Chinese Government would promise a new aid package to North Korea during the meeting. Then, in July 2018, the Chinese Government donated 1,000 tons of rice worth $1.02 million to the Government of North Korea (captured via Project ID#63061). By October 2018, the Chinese Government had also donated 162,007 tons of urea fertilizer worth $55.03 million to the Government of North Korea (captured via Project ID#63132).
justification: Project involves food aid and fertilizer donation, which are social development activities without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: 1,000 tons of rice donation, 162,007 tons of urea fertilizer donation, developmental food aid/food security assistance

title: Chinese Government donates 162,007 tons of urea fertilizer worth $55.03 million to North Korea in 2018 (Linked to Project ID#63061)
description: From May 7, 2018 to May 8, 2018, Chinese President Xi Jinping met with North Korean Kim Jong-Un in Dalian, China. It was widely reported at the time that the Chinese Government would promise a new aid package to North Korea during the meeting. Then, in July 2018, the Chinese Government donated 1,000 tons of rice worth $1.02 million to the Government of North Korea (captured via Project ID#63061). By October 2018, the Chinese Government had also donated 162,007 tons of urea fertilizer worth $55.03 million to the Government of North Korea (captured via Project ID#63132).
staff_comments: 1. 'The State of Play in Sino-DPRK Relations' and 'China drastically increases oil supply to N. Korea' suggest China promised to deliver 200,000 tons of urea fertilizer to North Korea. However, AidData has elected to use the 162,007 figure, as that was based on statistics from China's General Administration of Customs ('Food Aid Pours in Even as N.Korea Boasts of Grain Harvest').

title: Chinese Embassy donates office supplies to Third Chinese Primary School (Linked to Project ID#88531)
description: On August 30, 2018, the Chinese Embassy in North Korea donated office supplies to Third Chinese Primary School. The supplies included a television and printers. The donation also included computers. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  Third Chinese Primary School is located in Sadong-guyok (Sadong District) of Pyongyang and is dedicated to the education of the children of overseas Chinese families. The Overseas Chinese Affairs provided funds to renovate the school in 2018, as captured by linked project ID#88531.
staff_comments: The Chinese name of the school is 第三中国人小学.
combined_text:
